Content_FullWidth.Title: Getting started with on online degree
Content_FullWidth.Abstract: Steps for transfer students to evaluate if on online degree program is a good fit for them.
Content_FullWidth.BodyCopy:
Do You Qualify?

BYU-Idaho's Online Degree programs allow former students of BYU-Idaho and Ricks College, LDS Business College, BYU, and BYU-Hawaii to finish their degree even though they have moved away from campus. In addition, anyone who has completed at least 15 credits of LDS Church Education System (BYUI Pathway) credits also qualifies.

For details, please click on this link:

http://beta.byui.edu/online/online-degree/prospective-students/qualification

Decide which degree you are interested in.

List of available online degrees.

 

Determine the degree requirements.

Requirements for each degree can be viewed by clicking on the links below. These links will take you to the University Catalog page which lists all classes that need to be completed for each Degree. You may wish to print or save the file for comparison.

  • A.A.S. Administrative Asst./Office Mgt.
  • B.S. Applied Management
  • B.S. Business Management -Available Winter 2011*
  • B.A. English -Available Winter 2011*
  • A.S. General Studies
  • B.S. Health Care Administration -Available Fall 2013*
  • B.S. Marriage and Family Studies -Available Winter 2011*
  • A.A.S. Medical Assisting -Available Fall 2013*
  • B.S. Nursing (RN to BSN)
  • B.S. Public Health -Available Fall 2013*
  • B.S. University Studies
  • A.A.S. Web Design and Development -Available Winter 2013*
  • B.S. Web. Design and Development -Available Winter 2013*

*Notes when all classes will be available for a degree. Students may begin working on a program prior to this date if they plan on graduating on or after this date. Students who currently need upper division classes should choose another major. Students must complete 30 upper division credits to graduate with a BYU-Idaho degree.

Have you completed any course work that would apply toward this Degree?

If you have attended another College or University, you may have transferable credits that would apply toward your chosen degree. You can compare your transcripts from other institutions to determine if existing credits apply.*

This link will take you to a web page which can help you make this determination:

http://www.byui.edu/registrars office/CollegeCourseEquivalencies.htm

If you are a recent BYUI or Ricks College Student, you may click here to view your unofficial transcript: https://my.byui.edu/ICS/Former_Student/ or contact the registrar's office at http://www.byui.edu/registrars office/TranscriptRequest.htm

Once you have all records of previous coursework, you may compare what you have completed with what is needed for your chosen degree.

*Note: The BYUI Registrar's office will make an official determination regarding which previous courses and credits will apply.

Apply for admission to the Degree Program.

You are ready to apply to the Program to begin your degree!

Follow the Instructions on the following web-page:

http://beta.byui.edu/online/online-degree/prospective-students/application
